damn.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: used when you are very annoyed or disappointed
damn.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: Damn! I’ve left my keys in the office.
damn.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: used when something is impressive or surprising
damn.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: The band sounded pretty damn good.
I’ll damn well do as I please.
You know damn well what I’m talking about.
damn.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: used when you are angry or annoyed with someone or something
damn.translation[2].definitions[1].examp: It’s a damn shame he left her.
damn.translation[3].definitions[0].defin: to state that something is very bad
damn (somebody/something) with faint praise (=show that you think someone or something is not good by only praising them a little)
damn.translation[3].definitions[0].examp: The critics damned the play on the first night.
